intro: Ecbolium virgatum, commonly known as the Virgin's shield, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Ecbolium virgatum is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
